name: Nicole Finley
text: LOVE the staff at JBD! Tammy, Mark, Santana, Zach— they’re all phenomenal!! I can’t walk in without leaving with something in my (or on my) hands! Such beautiful, unique pieces of jewelry and I get the most compliments on ALL of the time. And can NOT beat their prices. Highly recommend- if you’re looking for a piece or want to design a piece, Jewelry By Design should be your FIRST stop!

name: Lauren Kiskunes
text: Absolutely wonderful staff! I brought in a 15 year old necklace with a broke clasp and they fixed it on the spot in less than 5 minutes. Highly recommend

resp.text: Hi Lauren, thanks for your positive review! We are so happy that you allowed JBD to help with your special piece. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Madeline Morrell
text: Make sure you ask for your total for ALL work being done. I was being told prices for one, not the total for both. And have them circle and clearly state the quoted price before signing! It felt extremely sketchy and you're stuck when they surprise you with the true cost at pickup! I will never come here again. Poor communication and subpar customer service.

resp.text: Madeline Morrell Stewart, thanks for your feedback & your mailed letter. We set a high standard for ourselves in serving our clients & we're sorry that this was not met in your interaction with our business.  We strive to be as clear & transparent with itemized pricing on our service envelopes detailing parts, labor & totals along with a detailed description of work to be done as to remove any chance of surprise at pickup.  Regarding your visit, we created two separate envelopes because we provided two different services, one pair of earrings with 18k protector backs & specialty posts & one pair of earrings with 18ky screw posts & screw backs.  On each envelope, we included an in-depth description of parts & labor needed to complete your job along with the total.  Each envelope had a total written & differing totals ($257.10 & $300.70) due to different mechanisms.  We DID obtain your signature on each envelope as acknowledgement & confirmation of the details regarding the services BEFORE we proceeded.  We understand that your complaint is that our 10 yr. sales professional, Santana, did not give you "the grand total verbally".  It is very typical for a client that may want to pick up their services independently from one another, i.e.:  $257.10 one week & the $300.70 the next week.  Although we may have fallen short with "verbally" providing you with the grand total, we were completely transparent with our detailed written description & totals for each signed envelope.  We do value you as a new customer as well as your other family members & hope you will reconsider visiting Jewelry by Design in the future.

name: Leah Smith
text: Wonderful staff and customer service! They are so kind and helpful and want their customers pleased. Beautiful work and jewelry!

resp.text: HI Ms. Smith. Thank you so much for your kind words & sweet review! Thank you for your business & we look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Patty Gleeson
text:
My 1.5 ctw wedding ring was appraised at 1.24 ctw by jbd. My 2 ctw tennis bracelet was appraised by jbd at 1.45 ctw. My 5 ctw aquamarine pendant was appraised by jbd at 3 ctw. No mention of the need to remove stones to receive an accurate appraisal when I brought my pieces in. Needless to say the low carat weights greatly lowered the appraised value of my pieces. The appraisals were finished a week late. No courtesy call to let me know they wouldn't be ready on time. I called multiple times upon the scheduled ready date and after to check in on their progress. I finally
requested that they call when the pieces were ready. Overall an extremely disappointing experience. And unfortunately the appraisals are virtually worthless.

name: Jack Hopkins
text: I brought a newly purchased watch in to be refitted & the experience was first-rate. Met three of the employees & they were extremely friendly & professional. Would definitely recommend them & their service.

name: Crystal Landcaster
text: The customer service here is WONDERFUL! I simply cannot speak highly enough of this store! I brought in a family ring I inherited and wanted to melt it down and create a new right hand ring. When I went in, I had absolutely no idea what I wanted it to look like, I just knew I wanted a right hand ring. Other places I have been to, I would walk around and just look to get ideas, and people would get very frustrated with me or just ignore me. When I came into Jewelry by Design, and told them I didn't have any idea of a style I wanted, they were so helpful and patient and were excited to work with me and show me different pieces. It was actually fun working with them! Not to mention, being a part of the entire process and seeing it be created from beginning to end. It also made me feel so much better that they do everything right there in the store, they don't send anything off unlike other places in town. They also scoped my diamond with me to show me how to identify it so I knew it was my same diamond when I got it back. I will always recommend them to everyone! I am always treated like family when I walk in the door, I just love the feeling of a small town "local jeweler" I absolutely LOVE this place!

resp.text: Thank you so much Crystal! We truly enjoyed working with you and are so glad we got to be a part of the memories of your special ring! Creating new designs is our passion and we love to include our customers in the entire process; from beginning to end. We hope you are still enjoying your ring and we highly look forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you so much for the sweet words!

name: Alex Vroom
text: I am not a person that typically writes negative reviews but this was an experience that had to be shared. I walked into Jewelry by Design with my custom made, one of a kind engagement ring. It has 4 bands that meet in the back. My engagement ring had cracked where the bands meet and one of the bands had broken off. I still don’t know how it happened but I was devastated so I took it in to get it repaired. I took it to Jewelry by Design because of all the great reviews and because the original jeweler was now retired. When I took it in, the service was great and I also asked to resize down 1/4 size because it had been fitting loosely. My first indication that something wasn’t right should have been when they didn’t check to see if they agreed that I needed it resized. When I came back for my ring, I could no longer put it on my finger after only going down a 1/4 size and they had bent the bands causing the halo for the diamond to be out of place. It no longer looked like the same ring and the setting for the diamond was crooked. I went back to them the next day and explained that I believed somewhere in the resizing process/repair that some of the bands looked a little out of place and asked if they would be able to fix it. I also brought a picture of the ring to show how it looked originally. The jeweler at this point was incredibly rude and even asked if the picture was of the same ring. I then explained to him that it was and stated again that this was a one of a kind ring and that it did not look like the picture and also didn’t fit. He then proceeded to tell me that I had not needed to get it resized in the first place and didn’t understand why I had gotten it resized. He also said that he had only done work in the back so anything that was messed up in the front was not his doing. He walked away at this point and his sales rep picked up the conversation asking if we wanted it resized. I said yes and that I would like it fixed to look like the picture. She relunctantly asked me to send the picture to the store email. I was charged more for the resizing than I had been originally and they told me it would take a week to resize it. I should have at this point taken it elsewhere but I wanted to give them a chance to fix their mistake. A week later I got a call in which the jeweler said that he had gotten it “as close as humanly possible to the picture.” He also said that the ring was unstable and that it needed additional structural support insinuating that it was poorly designed. My fiancé picked up the ring and much to our disappointment and frustration it looked nothing like the picture. The 4 bands had originally been crossing and now they were parallel to each other. On top of that they removed the 14k gold stamp from the inside of the band. I hope that doesn't mean that they used some other metal when they resized it. I don’t know how he thought that it looked like the picture. I have shown several friends and family members the before pictures and what it looks like now and they all agree that it’s not even close. To make matters worse he added tacks to the ring saughtering the bands together. This was not part of the original design nor had we asked for it and he never called to ask before he modified the ring. The jeweler was again very rude to my fiancé when he picked up the ring making comments about how the design was unstable and insinuated the damage to the ring had been some how done by my fiancé between leaving the store and giving it back to me 10 minutes later. We believe that our poor treatment was due to our college age and that the piece was from another jeweler. The jeweler who had created our ring had designed most of my family’s engagement rings, had been in business as a family for over 80 years, and was highly respected as a master jeweler for his unique design and pieces. So to anyone who has jewelry designed by another jewler or who is young do not go to this establishment because they are extremely arrogant and have no respect for you or your jewelry.

name: Pamela Biggs
text: I love this store!  The people are so friendly and take time to show you items. I have made 2 purchases there so far and will be back. Definitely go there if you are looking for jewelry!

name: William Martin
text: This is the best jewelry store I have been to in my twenty years of fine jewelry shopping. I was treated as if I was shopping without a budget. There was no rushing or hurrying. They took their time to show me pieces and made sure that I was happy with my selection. I was so happy with the service I took in my wife’s ring she was left by her mom to have it repaired and resized. It was fixed and looks brand new! The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly! This is the only place I will shop for jewelry from now on!

name: Brandi Robinson
text:
My husband and I went to Jarrods’s in Mobile Thursday to buy our granddaughter a pair of earrings for her birthday. The party was on Sunday. Jessica, our sales person, said we don’t have them in this store but let me call another and see if they have them. They did!!! Great!!!! She said they will be overnighted to Mobile store . Plenty of time to get them for the birthday party. Called Friday, did not come in. That’s fine, a truck comes in Saturday and Sunday. We call Saturday. Still hasn’t come in. I call back and ask them to track them. Jessica says it’s not on ‘her’ it’s on the other store that was overnighting them. What?!? I ask her to please follow up and ca them. Ask them what’s going on, have they been sent, can they track them ...
Jessica never bothered calling back.
Poor little grand baby did not get her earrings for her birthday. Thanks a lot Jessica !!!! For not doing your job.

name: Kristin McCarron
text: The location is awesome! Customer service is the best! They were so willing to go out of the way to help me find exactly what I was looking for! I will be sure to shop here for every occasion!

name: Tyler Thomas
text: HANDS DOWN the best customer service! My husband and I went in to look for new wedding bands, and from the moment we stepped foot in the door we were greeted with warm welcomes by the staff. Trixie, Jessica, and Henry to be specific. These employees know what they are doing and know how to make a customer feel comfortable going through such a large purchase. I highly recommend this location and the above mentioned employees.

name: Bethany Heathcock
text: The employees were so nice and very willing to help. They dont discriminate either because i walk inside in very simple clothes. They are very helpful.

name: Shey Thorn
text: This was the absolute best experience in Jewlery shopping in my life. We started off coming in on Monday, when we were greeted by the whole staff and had our sale taken over by Henry. Henry was extremely kind and listened to everything we wanted, we viewed some stunning Men's rings, but decided to sleep on the purchase decision and make our minds up the next day. We came back in today, Tuesday, and we were greeted by Jessica, once again extremely kind and helpful, who helped us complete our sale. Throughout our stress free, easy process we were offered water by the GM, Trixie. She chatted with us about her amazing jewelry endeavors and made us feel right at home as we were completing our purchase. We are still in shock at the OUT OF THIS WORLD INCREDIBLE service we received. We can't wait to continue shopping with Jared, and we look forward to the amazing new selection of items coming within the next months!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

name: Michael Vanden Heuvel
text: I've never been to any jewelry store in my life. I wanted to propose to my girlfriend, now fiance, and I knew the ring had to be spectacular. I stopped here on a whim for the sake of comparing prices to the other stores in the area. To be frank, I never saw those other stores. After a single visit at this location I was won over by their customer service, products, and in-store repair shop. As soon as I walked in the door I was greeted by Elizabeth Herboso. She was incredibly helpful and really knew her stuff. She helped me every step of the way and made the entire process from beginning to end very smooth, easing my mind any time I became unsure. But most of all she was very friendly and genuinely enthusiastic about getting the exact right ring for me and my bride-to-be. I couldn't have asked for a better first experience and I will most definitely be returning for future purchases.

name: Joe LeNoir
text: I purchased a Tag Heuer F1 watch for my birthday present to myself. The lady who helped me with my purchase was fantastic. Her name was Elizabeth I believe. I got it home and ended up being unhappy with the watch. I googled their return policy and read one after another terrible reviews about their sales persons attitude about returns. So, naturally I expected to have a hard time. Once I got there, I spoke with Karen, the manager very briefly about my issues with the watch. She apologized several times and immediately refunded my money. The process took less than 10 minutes. All in all I was/am very very satisfied with Elizabeth/Karen/Jared! They are great and I highly recommend them. Ill definitely be back to purchase other pieces of jewelry.

name: Robert Turner
text: The protocol to getting the store is ridiculous and the lady working in the store was rude.

name: Brittany Vickers
text: Walked in wanting to upgrade my diamond in my engagement ring. Was immediately greeted and that was it. There 20 min and not helped. Walked out and will never return.

name: William Schenher
text: Kayla helped me and was awsome. She got me in and out fast. Great service. Great salesperson!

name: Sheila Haviland
text: My fiance and I met with Jessica. I told her what I was looking for and she picked out several setting for me.  Found the one I loved and we left keeping that ring in mind.  Visited 2 other jewelers only to return to Jareds. I did change my mind and decided on a cushion cut over a round diamond. She picked out  an almost flawless stone. The setting was white gold and we wanted platinum so they have to make a new setting and the gallery was to small for the stone so they will make the gallery to fit the stone. Awesone service, knowledgeable staff, friendly while being professional, treated us like family. Can't wait to see the end product , another 5-6 weeks. My fiance was pleased with the service  and their attention to details, and that says alot . I have since ordered his platinun wedding band waiting for it to arrive next week

name: WB Spencer
text: Bought my son a Tag Heuer watch for his 16th birthday.  Very helpful staff and helped me pick out the right one for our budget.  I had never shopped a "chain" jewelry store before and was pleasantly surprised.  Will definitely go back here for any future watch or jewelry purchases!

name: Derek Scarbrough
text: Without a doubt the Manager and the staff are the nicest and most helpful you can find. Have bought several items from the mobile store and will continue to do all of my jewelry shopping there.

name: JaCoiya Hall
text: The staff here is unbelievable!  They have become like family .. Everyone is very knowledgeable and sooo inviting .. I find myself in there for at least an hour after getting my jewelry cleaned just chit chatting. .You have to visit this store!!

name: Crystal Hinds
text: WARNING: DO NOT PURCHASE FROM HERE! My husband bought me a necklace we decided to return. He paid cash. The manager informed him they do not have enough of cash in the store (only $420) and they could mail us a check that would take 10 days to receive or they would call us once they have enough of cash onsite. This seems completely inconceivable and absolutely ridiculous to me that a nationwide store could legally operate like this. I’ve never in my life. And we will never, ever shop there again.

name: Christin Lisenby
text: I was shocked to find this location rated a 1 star! Thomas and his team have treated me like family since my first visit in December 2016! They have gone above and beyond and I enjoy doing business with people who put the customer first and are so professional! I rarely leave reviews, but felt the need when seeing one persons negative experience, causing so much damage to this business.... Great job guys! I'm a BIG FAN!!!  Christin

name: Hanna Love
text: The Manager Trixie has a very unpleasant attitude towards her co-worker. I seen her completely ignore a girl in a lab coat because she was doing something on the computer. I seen the girl talking to her and she didn’t even acknowledge her. How can you manage a team and treat them like that. I will not be coming back here. Sorry attitude I did not like. The girl was very kind to her. I had Henry help me with my Ever Us ring and I will recommend friends to see him. I also seen employees standing around talking loud so inapproiate.

name: Kia Sheridan
text: I had an absolutely wonderful experience! Emma the salesperson was an absolute doll!

name: The Chambers
text: Always a pleasure doing business their longtime customer

name: Cameron Blake
text: My boyfriend bought me a pair of earrings ($620)which I couldn't have at the time due to circumstances.  So a full refund sounds simple right? wrong. Upon visiting the location  throughout the day only to still be told that they (Jared) didn't have enough cash which sounds silly actually. While being within our 30 day period. This location is very bad as far as customer satisfaction. Both the Black woman and old slim Caucasian woman should seek for another occupation. I was told that night there's another Jared's in Pensacola so I asked well did you call that store to see if they had the amount of cash? basically she informed me that she doesn't have common sense. You wouldn't want to do business with someone who is incompetent would you?

name: Courtney Pemberton
text: Terrible experience. They did not deliver what they had promised, but rather a ring that had bad welds and a crooked diamond. And returning it was a nightmare, they did not refund all the money until we came back a second time. More like a galleria of incompetency.

name: John Wilson
text:
The store is very clean the people that I have dealt with inside are extremely nice and professional however their customer service department is a complete pile of crap. I have a credit card through their Genesis Bank. I was made to put a deposit down when I bought something I was also told that every time I buy something I have to put a deposit down. When I call Genesis they told me that even if I have an available credit limit they run and check your credit every time you purchase something and if they feel like not approving it for whatever reason they will not approve it even though you have available credit on your card they've already given you. I was not happy with that so I called Jared customer service and what I was basically told was we do not control the credit cards are banks policy is our bank's policy if you have a problem with it call them..
I'm 55 years old I think credit cards from different jewelry companies different clothing stores and all other places. When you give me a credit card I expected to be a credit card you don't walk into JCPenney's buy $500 worth of clothes and have to give them $60 in advance you swipe your card you sign your paper and you leave.. what Jared is doing is not giving customers credit cards there financing the jewelry like you with your car or your house but they don't tell you that upfront.. so even though the people and the three different Jared stores that I've been to have been very professional and very nice because of your business practices you guys suck. I will pay the balance off of my card cut it up and never do business with you again..

name: Kim Newman
text: My husband bought me a $2,500 cross necklace as a gift.  The chain was too short, he went back to swap it for a longer chain.  They wanted to give him a $15 credit for the chain and sell him a $150 chain. Really???  So your chains are only worth $15 and you sell them for $150?!!  Crooks! Take my advice NEVER shop at Jared!

text: That's really make miracles happen here I love it

I hunted for diamond stud earrings for my wife for our anniversary at many stores for several weeks.. Dealt with the manager and she was most helpful. She found me the perfect pair with the 4 C's I was looking for. She was understanding of what I was looking for and very courteous.  Most of all, she was very professional and helpful with my purchase.

I will always return to Kay's for the quality service I received.

text: My daughter ordered a heart beat necklace and ring on May 3rd, as of yesterday June 26th I received the necklace but no ring. The clasp on the necklace is broken and I can’t get any one to answer the phone at the local office.

name: Rayshundra Davis
text: Great Customer Service.  Friendly staff and willing to help anyone that comes in. They take the time to get to know you and what your needs or desires are. Whenever I've encountered an issue, they took the time to try to solve the problem.  I always feel valued when I'm there.

text: My engagement ring was supposed to be sent to Virginia by a week ago, in a 6 prong setting. They haven't even started on it and it's 2 weeks later. I won't see my boyfriend again till the wedding. They ordered a 5 prong setting in white gold instead of yellow gold. They promised us again it'd be here by the 9th, we contacted them again and they said the repair shop still hasn't even gotten the part or promised to ship it. We just want the ring back. We don't even want the ring fixed by them. Kay's is awful! Do not trust them!

name: Sherri Beck
text: They sales rep was absolutely remarkable they make you feel like they have known forever and work with you with a smile even if you are undecided and take awhile to make your own choices they do not rush you or make you feel as though you are taking up their time and they work with you till you find that perfect ring that says we will lol thank you Kay Airport Blvd Bell Air Mall I love my Wedding set your staff is the best oh and it doesn't matter what your budget amount is you will leave there with what you came for and in your price range and very satisfied thanks again

name: Hope Fulton
text: I got the ring and it immediately had to be sent in for three weeks to be sized. It was sent back to me with one of the stones chipped, and then a different stone fell out of it a few weeks later. I took it in to have both stones replaced. It was gone for three weeks and was sent back to me with two stones chipped. They had to damage it out and give me a new one which was sent out for three weeks to be sized. I went to pick it up on the 'promise date' and at first they told me they lost it, but then they said it hadn't even been shipped out from their store to be sized until the day after I was supposed to pick it up. Throughout all of this Debbie has been extremely rude when I go in to the store. This whole experience has been a nightmare and I will never shop with Kay again.

I sent my ring off to get sized. They said it would take 10 days and would be due back April 23. I called that morning and they proceed to tell me they do not get shipments on the weekends, but it should be here Monday. So I called again Monday morning and they told me the sizing company was running behind and it wouldn't be here until Wednesday!
Now, I'm due to leave out of town for 10 days and I will not have my engagement ring! I am very disappointed.

name: Dr.Ritchelle Broadnax,DNP,CRNP
text: This is the worst jewelry store I’ve ever come across. I bought a necklace that I wanted to be shorter. It was immediately sent off to repair to be shortened for me.  I was never able to bring the necklace home. It’s been a month. Every time repair sends it back to the store it doesn’t pass the quality inspection and is sent back. I was actually in the store for one of the instances and saw for myself that the necklace was uneven and has some discoloration. However, there is obviously a lack of skill in their repair department because they can’t seem to get this simple adjustment done. So, basically I have purchased a necklace that Zales themselves have ruined and I will never bring home. I called Corporate and they NEVER answer the phone. You’ll be listening to music and fun facts about Opals for hours. I’ll be returning to the store to simply get a refund. Worst experience ever. I should have went to Jareds.

name: Malcolm Banks
text: Came to Zales today to get the Valentine's Day special and they were sold out! I was crushed! I sat and thought for a moment and I asked Gina one of the salespeople was it possible to buy one on order and she was able to make sure that I got my order and it was sent to the right place! The customer service from everyone was outstanding!

name: James Serritelli
text: Can't even answer the phone

name: Justin Golson

name: Sarah
text:
Horrible. When sizing my engagement ring, they messed up the writing that was on the underside of the band, and a diamond chip was missing.

When I called, the manager refused to replace the ring. They were nasty and horrible on the phone; I’ve never gone through such a thing. They ruined my ring and refused angrily to fix it.

I had to bring my DAD down there with me in person to demand a new ring. They were intimidated into doing it.

As soon as I got my new ring, one of the 3 main diamonds fell out.

I will never go to Zale’s ever again, not even if I were on fire and they had water. What a joke. Nasty people; horrible merchandise. My diamonds probably aren’t even real.

text: You should be able to navigate the website without dealing with all of their ads and BS. Just trying to get an idea of their inventory. My idea don't bother with the store.

name: Butch Palmer
text:
Also had a terrible experience.  Not worth the price, not worth the time, and they will LIE to you to get you to buy from here.  Bought an engagement ring from here, paid half up front, said that I would pay the other half when I get back into the country (just in case she declined the proposal).  Well, when I got back and paid it off, they had already sent a mispayment to my credit history and LIED AGAIN, saying that they would erase it from there.  They put me down for a payment plan, of which I didn't want, because I WAS OUTSIDE OF THE COUNTRY.  If I pay half, and say I'm going to pay the other half in three months, that's what I'm going to do.

Any business that promotes this kind of lying deserves to shut down.

text: Excellent visit!!  Store is kept clean and sanitary. The staff is top notch!!!!  Unfortunately they were unable to clean my jewelry but they had cleaner available for purchase. They helped educate me on how to clean it.  So glad I know how to properly clean my jewelry in the safety of my home! So willing to go above and beyond!!!  Will shop at Kay Jewelers in Prattville for life!!! Thanks again ladies!!!!

name: Kristy Kanagala
text: I absolutely love this location! They work hard to build a relationship with you and get to know your needs and wants. They are consistently kind and attentive.

name: andrew runge
text: Awesome customer service. My wife’s wedding band lost a diamond recently so we took it to Kay’s to get fixed. They had to mail the ring off and it was back at their store fixed in no time. I’m currently working 6 days a week so Sunday is our only day to get stuff done. We drove to Kay’s (about 45 minutes) to find out they were closed do to a busted water pipe. I sent Adrienne an email and within 30-40 minutes she was at the the store to meet me and give us the ring. Couldn’t ask for better service!

name: william norris
text: I would like to start that I have never left a review for any business I have ever used. This experience has been an exception. I ordered a wedding ring on November 11th and it was scheduled to arrive on November 22. We check in several times up through December 11th and the order had not arrived. This was fine because our wedding is not until February 6th. In mid December, the store manager, Adrienne, realized that the ring had mistakenly been shipped to Oklahoma. I understand there are a lot of shipping issues at the moment so I completely understood. On December  23rd, I called and was told by the store manager that the best direction to go would be to do a completely new order and that is would be scheduled to arrive in mid January. For a wedding on February 6th, a mid January shipment was cutting it too close for comfort considering our experience to this point. Hopefully canceling the order and getting my money back will be a better experience. Unfortunately, I could not recommend purchasing a blow pop from this store.

name: Erin Putter (Chasing Life's Adventure)
text: Refused to help. I understand that we are dealing with COVID and all but this location is keeping the doors locked and makes you wait outside until they see you. I went there with the intent to get my wedding rings sent off for sizing and soldering. Was told I needed an appointment. No one was in the store and I asked to simply give her my rings and wait for the paperwork outside. Was told no. What is so precious in a jewelry store that they have to be on a near lockdown status but I can go nearly anywhere else at this point? I wonder why they don’t just close the store for the duration so they can stop paying people to do nothing.

name: Caesar How
text: The manager is awesome and always there and her staff rocks. Her commitment to service keeps me coming back. Every business needs someone like her for sustainability and image. She is a true gem for Kay and I will continue to come back as long as she is there.

(Edit to owners response) as I stated above your store did have my rings. From the 6th of December until the 14th when my wife picked them back up to take them elsewhere since they had yet to be touched. Luckily she did this or we would have been overcharged by $260. text: DO NOT SHOP HERE! My wife and I both ordered our wedding bands from Marquirettes during one of their crazy sales and were really happy about the price. It was certainly too good to be true because while my ring came in after a few weeks as advertised, my wife's band took much longer than they said it would. We timed it out where I would be able to pick up her ring before I left school after graduation and that time passed. We figured it would only be a bit behind schedule, but after 4-5 months of waiting (on a 6-8 week purchase) we had to buy a new band from somewhere else. We didn't receive a single call or email from them regarding the delayed shipment and we had to call every couple of weeks to hear that it was on its way. They had apparently ordered it from overseas and instead of getting us a new ring when ours didn't show up they just sat around and waited for it. it got to be a month before our wedding and we knew we couldn't wait any longer so we had to call them up and demand a refund (because they didn't offer us one even after all that time). This was by far the worst customer service I have ever dealt with and will not ever recommend this company to anyone. PLEASE learn from my mistake and don't ever purchase something from here unless you are 100% sure you can leave the store with it on the spot.

name: Jennifer P
text: I'd wanted to have my bridal set redesigned for years, but I was really unsure how to go about it.  My husband has bought several pieces of jewelry for me at Marquirette's over the past few years.  I've gotten to feel comfortable with them. Since our 10th anniversary was approaching, I asked Benjy to help with the redesign.  He asked me to give him an idea of the style I like. I printed out a few images online and we looked through the cases for similar styles. The diamonds from my original bridal set were princess cut, and I wanted them to be the focal point in the new ring. I found a setting in the store that I really liked, but it didn't accommodate my diamonds. Benjy went to work measuring and configuring a new setting based on all these different components. A few days later he showed me a digital image of the proposed new ring. We talked about it, tweaked a few items, took more measurements, and he had an updated image of the design a few days later.  I was very happy with what he'd come up with, so we moved forward with having the mounting casted. A couple weeks later they took my diamonds to be placed in the new setting. My husband and I picked up the new ring this past week. I'm blown away!  It's breathtaking!  Far better than I imagined. We cannot thank Benjy, Abby, Lyle and all the sweet ladies who work at Marquirette's enough. I would never have taken the leap without their guidance and expertise. They have a customer for life in me!

name: Elliot K
text:
My fiance and I had a horrible experience dealing with the very unprofessional staff at Marquirette's and would not recommend them to anyone.  We had an engagement ring custom-made and it took us almost SIX months to finally get the ring back.  We never got exactly what had been promised, but finally got close enough and gave up.   During the stressful course of events, many things happened that were unprofessional and just poor business. Some of the lowlights include:

-the staff repeatedly forgot that we were using our own gems (the whole reason we had a ring custom made)

-staff seemingly just forgot about us multiple times.  they were supposed to send a design and a week, two weeks, three weeks would go by and then i would call to check and they would make up an excuse about their e-mail system crashing or their daughter had accidentally deleted their e-mails.

-Had the ring made a completely wrong size (even after telling them repeatedly in person and through e-mail the correct size)

-After ring had been made the completely wrong size, we were told they would fix it as soon as possible.  I received a phone call two days later saying that everything was taken care of and the ring had been resized.  We came into town the following day to pick up the ring and it had not been touched.  It was still the same wrong size it had originally been made.  Then the jeweler who would have to resize was out of town on vacation for a week.

-When it finally was resized, the bands did not fit snugly against the engagement ring like they had before, and the staff was condescending to my finance and tried to make her think it had always fit that way.

-The staff lost our extra diamonds and gold from the ring then tried to act like we had traded those in, even though that had never been discussed.

The store looks fancy and the staff looks professional, but it is all a facade.  If you just need to walk in and buy a ring, they could probably get that right, but I would NOT trust them with any custom work and will not be using them again for any of our jewelry needs.

name: Mitty Parker
text: I had very bad experience all of the staff was stuck up besides one of them i bought a bracelet they sized it wrong i took it back to them and they wasn't even trying to meet me half way in the middle all of their is to expensive but not worth a dime oh btw the manager don't even knowledge his customers so i will never go back again

name: Hope Chandler
text: This is a complaint for the labs they use not the actual store itself... I sent my ring off a month ago to be resized and have my bands put together, it came back a week ago and there was a crack in my band so she sent it back off to another lab. Comes back in today and the ring looks like the lab didn’t even touch it still has the crack in it and all so she’s sending it back off again... these labs they use don’t do inspections before they send the jewelry back and they do poor jobs. We don’t spend thousands of dollars for our stuff to be treated like this.. The employees at the store in the mall are very helpful and understand my frustration and are just as mad as I am.

name: Lily Angelovich
text: Went in there tonight and nobody even said hello or even tried to help us. Don’t judge a book by it’s cover. I was going to pay cash for the jewelry but since they were too busy talking and not trying to even help I’ll take my business elsewhere.

text:
Refused service due to me not wearing a mask which I cannot medically wear one ...

I'll spend my money elsewhere in the future.

Thanks for all the help Princess.

name: Lanie Dixon
text: Terrible customer service!!! My fiancé and I went to Kay’s in Wiregrass Commons over the weekend to try on wedding bands to go with my ring. They were pretty busy, busier than they normally are when I’m at the mall, so we decided to go visit another store since we knew we wouldn’t be helped for a while. We came back about 30 minutes later and there were 2 customers in the store. We sat down and waited for them to be helped first. We sat in the store for an HOUR and not ONE employee acknowledged us, told us they would be right with us, apologized, nor thanked us for waiting. We kept being walked by like we were dust on the ground. One of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. Do better!!! I seriously could not believe the experience we had.

name: Amelia Whitaker
text: The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  They helped me with an item that needed work.  I have also been pleasantly pleased with the ring and earrings purchased from them.  Thank you Janet, and your staff.  Y'all are awesome!

name: Jerri O'Donohoe
text: Kay Jewelers treats us like Royals. Sophia and the staff at Pearland Town Center are fabulous! We highly recommend Kay's.

name: Kristen Galego
text: Just left Kay's in dothan thanks to kayla! Thank you kayla for making my dream come true. You went above and beyond for me everytime I look at my ring I'll be reminded of your amazing customer service <3.

name: Kamron Higgins
text: I had such a great seamless experience . They listened to my likes and dislikes and provided me with the perfect ring ! The sales lady Kailah was amazing , she took her time and gave me plenty of options to choose from . She even took the time to learn how me and my now fiance met . Thank you kay jewelers Dothan for everything!

name: Crystal Arnold
text: My husband, 2 kids and I went in last Friday to look for new bands for our vow renewal next month. We had the pleasure of Kailah, Svetlana and Kassie helping us pick our new rings. I tired on MANY and went back and forth...I was THAT customer and they were nothing but patient and didnt try to push a sale. They wanted to make sure I got exactly what I wanted. My girls started to get a bit restless after a couple HOURS and they got them something to keep them busy so my husband and I could shop. Thank you ladies for your kindess and we will be back!

name: Holley Hawkins
text: If I could give this place a negative 10 that's what I would do. We have had such awful experiences with this place!!! I have 2 rings from them. One that was sent off 3 times. And a brand new one that I haven't even had a year sent off 5 different times!! Cracked stones, loose stones, bad brackets. It's really awful quality and awful customer service. We have been lied to over and over. Nothing has been done. My ring was supposed to be replaced this 5th time it's been gone and they never sent it off or ordered the replacement and I've been waiting since May!!!! Here it is August!!! I call to see if it was in because it was supposed to be here July 26th. They said yes. I go in to get it and it's my original, BROKEN ring!!!!!!! We will NEVER use Kay's again!!!!!!! The assistant manager Tara should be fired!!! She is AWFUL with customers and a liar!!! She was the one supposedly handling this!!!!!!

name: J j
text: The nicest and most professional Jewelry store I've experienced In awhile!! props to Tara and Janet for their outstanding customer service!!

I called on multiple occasions to find out about my ring and have yet to find out any information, very rude staff. This isn't the first time I have recieved a rude staff memeber either, I called to find out about a matching band and was given very rude customer service. I believe this will be the end of me buying from Kay.

text: Great, kind, down to Earth people. Being from Lawrence County, friends & family would always go to the shoals to do business with Jamie Hood Jewelers. So glad to have a Decatur store close to home too! Shop with them for all your needs! You won't be sorry!

text: I took my Citizen Eco Drive watch in to have the crystal replaced.  Estimated time was 2 Weeks.  After multiple trips and 5 weeks later my watch was ready. name: Steve Brown
text: Was looking to trade in a old ring I had purchased from Kay to bring down the cost. Found the ring I wanted in the store and decided to think about it. After leaving checked Kay's website and found the same ring for the same cost without trading in my ring. First thing came to mind was "You Croaks". I almost gave you "CROAKS" my ring for nothing. BUYERS BEWARE THIS IS WHAT IT HAS COME TO.

name: Deanna Salazar
text: My husband wanting to surprise me for Christmas this year 2020 and doing so we went to Kay in Decatur on the 24th of December. We got there and he purchase me a beautiful ring-! The young lady Jasmine was working and was helping us to decide and making this the best experience ever-! With the holidays here Jasmine told us it would take about 2 plus weeks for it to be returned. I went into the storr tonight just to see if my ring was back and to my surprise it was-! With the holidays and everything it did take the 2 weeks-! Jasmine and the other young lady that night (Diana) was wonderful-! Jasmine tonight was wonderfule-! I recommend them to anyone-! Thanks again Jasmine

name: Sarah Blakely
text: I went to Google to get the store's number and saw the last 2 reviews and had to say something! We will be calling corporate as well! We NEVER go to the Decatur location, because of past experiences,  but recently we had a wedding to attend in town and stopped in. Jessica, the store Manager, was INCREDIBLE.  I had dreaded walking in and she immediately made us feel at home. The reason I am leaving a review is because not only was the man claiming a dispute with his credit company in there and behaving like an absolute juvenile, I fully believe the call she received from who I gathered (from eavesdropping tbh) was corporate was in regards to the man on here complaining about "an order." First of all, I am a retail manager as well. If I gave a return on a machine we sent somewhere for maintenance I would lose my job.  The man acted like a baby, and my husband was irate that a grown man should behave that way. The manager, though, was nothing less than professional,  and dealt with it better than I would have for sure! Secondly,  when I listened to her phone conversation about pendant man,  Jessica said more than once but shouldn't we do something for him, they hadn't found out if they could yet (or something like that.) All I thought that day was wow, people are so rude, and it's not even their fault. I never thought I would recommend the Decatur store, but 100% I recommend to everyone! The staff is nice, I actually trust them for once, and the manager Jessica is clearly willing to go above and beyond to try to help you even when you act like a total jerk to her. I admit even I kinda did at first, I just expected the kind of service that caused us to stop going there. Jessica if you see this, you have customers for life - The Blakely Family

name: corey house
text: Dishonest, no Integrity, and their word means nothing. Bought diamond earrings from Decatur, Al store and thought ordered custom diamond picture pendant to match earrings. After several assurances the piece could be made kay finally told me the piece couldn't be made but would not take earrings back because 30 day window passed for refund but it passed because I was waiting on pendant to be made. I did inform kay in beginning that I was getting earrings and pendant as set. They finally told me custom order was never put in is the reason for no refund which wasnt my fault. I don't work for kay and I don't know the protocol  but the store manager took my order or at least I thought and once they couldn't deliver they used a technicality to keep my money. They dont have the best merchandise anyway but make sure you cross your t's and dot your i's when dealing with them.

name: Chasity Warren
text: I had went to two different jewelers to order my daughter a class ring and no one seemed to care to help, just told to go online. I did not know her size and she was with me but no one seemed to want to help. Walked into Kay jewelers on 6th ave and it was totally different. They were super friendly and there’s was also online but she pulled it up and ordered it with me there and sized my daughter. We received it today and went in to pick up and love it and also the same friendliness. Thank you for being good at what you do!

name: Amanda Lambert
text: Me and my husband were at Kay Jewelers tonight. The gentleman that helped us was very pleasant. We had a great experience picking out my valentine’s present.

name: Midnight_Rider 2020
text: Good and pretty jewelry

name: Jo Dumas
text: Bought a pocket watch for my son in law for his graduation from the police academy. Took it back there 2 times to have it engraved. They couldn't find the engraving paperwork both times. Thought since I purchased it there it wouldn't be a problem to have it engraved.Will be taking it somewhere else. Very unprofessional staff.

name: Ashlie Richie
text: I took my husbands wedding ring in to be sized and they told us to come back in two weeks to pick it up. When we got there to get his ring they couldn’t find it and asked us if we were sure it was this store that we used. Then they finally found it and the bag it was in had giant red writing on it that said “Have Not Paid”. I explained to the lady that when I bought the ring I also bought the warranty and that when they found us in the system two weeks prior that they said because I bought that we would not have to pay for it to be sized. She looked us up in the system and could not find us again. When we came in the first time they had trouble finding me in the system and the same lady took all my information and said she would update me in the computer so we would not have to go through all of that again. When I explained that, she laughed and said “Oh that was me haha I didn’t do it.” So they spend like 20 minutes just trying to find us in the computer and then acted like they didn’t want to give us our ring once they found us. We found out after we left that after all of that they did not even size it!! We definitely will NOT be coming back here.

name: Michael R
text: Gary, the manager, assured me my ring would be in the month before my wedding, and told me if he was ever out of the store his co-manager Cristy would take care of me. Nobody followed up with me regarding the ring or informed me they would not have it by the date we needed it. A week before the wedding date I called up to the store and was told Gary was out of town so I left my name and number and asked to have Cristy call me. No response. Two days later I called and again asked for Cristy by name. The girl came back to the phone and said Cristy did not call me back because Gary knew about my account, not her. She didn't take my call. We did not have a ring on the wedding date, we couldn't even talk to anybody who knew the status. I finally received the ring, well past the wedding date, about twice as long as Gary told me it would take. Gary repeatedly blamed the shop for not having or knowing about my ring. When I picked up the ring I told Gary they dropped the ball and I felt like they should adjust the price of the ring - or do something to make it right. Gary looked me in the eyes and told me "I will go to bat for you" in regards to making it right, he said he would contact me in a few days. After a month I called Gary back today to ask for his district managers number, in hopes of finally getting a resolution. Gary said to me, "I thought we were done when you picked up your ring". A far cry from going to bat for me like he said he would. I feel like Gary intentionally lied to me to get rid of me. I closed my account and wont do business with Kay or Gary or Cristy again.

name: Zach Richie
text: Not good service. Didnt believe we bought my wedding band there even though it was in the computer. Took it to get sized and it was never sized. The woman claimed we didn't have warranty on the ring and almost refused to give it to me. They finally found it in the computer and saying it wasn't purchased there and they pulled it up 2 weeks before hand. Will take my business elsewhere.

name: Captain_Redpill
text: Ever since the store changed locations and employees the only kiss that begins with this Kay's is kiss customer appreciation and service goodbye.

name: farrah derusseaux
text: Awesome, Excellent Customer Service

name: Landon Smith
text: Love the staff here! Very friendly and helpful.

name: Ashley Kirby
text: I had the worst experience ever with this store. I took my engagement ring in for its 6 month checkup and to go down a quarter of a size. They told me to come back in two weeks and it will be here. So two weeks later we go in to get it and it’s been ruined when they went to go down a half a size. Had a huge gash in it, popped out two big diamonds and a diamond on the side. We were heartbroken, they also told us that it was a discontinued ring so they couldn’t reorder another ring and to pick another ring. So I spent a couple days looking and just couldn’t find any ring that I liked. So I ended up going to the Kay’s in bridgestreet and instantly falling in love with one. Told them the situation and they were so shocked. They said they had never had a ring be sent off and be ruined at their store. They told me to tell Decatur which one I wanted and they could have it ordered. So my fiancé called Decatur asking if they could have it in my size and ordered and the girl said absolutely you can, come tomorrow and we will have it all ready for you. Well we go the next day and the girls calling all these places just to come back to me to say we can’t get your ring in a size for you so pick another ring. I was so upset. They ruined my ring, then told me the night before they could just to have me go all the way to the store to tell me no they can’t pick another one. I was so angry I ended up leaving. I later in the week went back to the bridestreet and they were so shocked with Decatur’s performance to us, they said we can absolutely get you the ring you want in the size you need and they were confused why Decatur told us we couldn’t. They told us to go into Decatur, get our ring and walk out and call customer service. So we did and the store manager himself fixed us up at bridgestreet with the ring we wanted, plus the band, the size we wanted, and ensured us it would be in two weeks in time for engagement pictures. Yesterday my ring came in, it’s absolutely perfect!! It just goes to show Decatur is very unprofessional, their workers are unskilled and the store manager not once came to handle the situation or talked to us about it even when we were two feet away from her. Decatur has forever lost my service and bridestreet will forever by my hero’s who came in and cleaned up their mess.

name: Brandi Perry
text: Sandy, the store manager, at the Decatur store, is so rude and unprefesionel. Kay lost a lot of family business because of her. She was so awful she was reported to cooperate. Sandy. Customer service is a must in retail.

text: The team at the Kay Jewelers in Brookwood Mall were a wonderful help and so patient while designing an upgraded ring for me.  Excellent service and seemingly unlimited options for even the pickiest bride.  If we ever upgrade again, this is where I'll go, hands down!

name: Dawn Productions
text: I had a great experience there today 12/11/19 as usual. I don’t know why I even attempted to go to any other Kay’s because they don’t have anything and they will basically harass you to buy something. However, I’ve never had that experience at Brookwood. The ladies are always helpful, nice, and they don’t harass you (which is a plus, because If I feel like you’re pressuring me I will walk out and not purchase anything.) Brookwood always have a great selection of jewelry and great customer service. And I am one of those people who “wants to buy something but don’t know what” aka “the complicated, undecided shopper”. Today a young girl name Chariot helped me trade my old ring and pick a new one I wanted to give my mom for Christmas.  She was guided by the of the mangers, I didn’t get her name. But she was a cute middle age black woman. They suggested things to help me make a decision and I purchased my moms gift and actually felt good about it. (Unlike when I purchase something at other Kay’s and end up returning it LOL). Thanks for helping me today and keep up the good work. Soon you guys soon !!!

text: My fiancé and I loved our experience here! Great staff who were knowledgeable and helped us find the perfect ring! We will be going back!

text: By far the best customer service I have ever received, my fiance and I went to pick out our wedding bands and was warmly greater by Ms. Blevins. She was extremely nice, extremely patient, and made sure we got exactly what we wanted at a great deal. She was extremely kind so much that we offered to take her to dinner for her amazing help. Such an incredible professional atmosphere. The rest of the staff was friendly to. I highly suggest going there and asking to speak to Ms.Blevins for she will make you feel right home. They were so friendly that we stay after our purchase for about a half hour just to have conversation. IF YOU WANT PROFESSIONAL AND KIND HELP LOOK NO MORE, MS.BLEVINS IS WHO YOUR LOOKING FOR.

The person seemed highly irritated once I told him I was just looking for a promise ring my boyfriend is buying for me. 10/10 do not recommend this store and will only be shopping at Zales or Jared’s form now on.

text: The manager, Christie, is one of the most nicest and most professional people that you will ever meet. My wife lost and earning and I was trying to replace it. Christie went above and beyond!!! text: I purchased a  Mother's Day present today at Kay Jewelers, and I had a pleasant and productive shopping experience.  Peggy was friendly and helpful.  Thank you!

name: Hannah Tell
text:
Go anywhere but here. Kays in general has some unethical sales practices. They WILL lie to you.

Returning the engagement ring we bought today because they told my anxiously excited BF the ring he picked was in my size (5) only to tell him after paying it was a 6 (another associate told me no ring in the store has EVER been in a 5) She just lied because she knew how badly he wanted to give me a ring now.

I plan to bring it back and tell her another kay store has it in my size just so I can hear her tell me "we never carry 5's" after that bold face lie she told my BF.

F*** Kays....they also told me id get an additional 10% off for getting a credit card, so I did even though we wanted to pay cash, only to be told right after getting approved the discount couldn't be applied. Now I'm stuck with their credit card. Seriously, just go ANYWHERE but kays. I have friends who have worked there and this is STANDARD.

name: Ashely Harrell
text: I truly want to give the ladies at the Kay Jewelers in the Riverchase Galleria Mall the biggest compliment I can. April and Christie went above and beyond with their customer service to help me with my issue and ensure all my needs were met. I had to get my wedding ring cleaned and repaired as a diamond had fell out. I sent the pieces of jewelry off mid-March and was expecting them back around early-April. My jewelry ticket consisted of one diamond in my band to be replaced, the three separate pieces sautered together, and the final ring cleaned. Upon mid-April, I did not hear from the store on the status of my ring so my husband and I went to the store in person to get an update. Ms. April informed me that the ring was being held because they wanted to make sure that I was okay with how the ring would potentially come out and discuss any pitfalls. I was informed there would be a potential gap in the ring once the pieces were sautered together. Upon me giving the okay, the ring was supposedly sent to be fixed and I continued to wait patiently. During that time, Ms. April helped me find two other LeVian rings that were on sale and that were absolutely gorgeous and suitable to wear at my job. I decided that once my other rings came back, I would get the two new rings resized for my finger. Coming into the first week of May, I discovered my ring was still not back and at this point I was getting very flustered. Ms. Christie spoke with me and ensured that she would get my ring repaired and back to me quickly and had apologized for the long wait. She personally made sure to let the jeweler know to expedite the process. When my ring finally did arrive back, the middle stone of the main ring was still cloudy, there was black residue on the ring bands, the ring was resized even smaller than my finger, and the same diamond was missing when it was presented to me. At this point I was livid, upset, and refused to do any more business with Kay Jewelers. Despite my ordeal, Ms. April and Ms. Christie showed me the greatest empathy for my situation. I was given a comforting and sorrowful hug from Ms. April. Ms. Christie personally took my ring to the jeweler and stayed with it until it was complete so that I would have the ring that same day and not have to wait any longer then I already had. In addition, she ensured that the other two rings that I recently purchased was resized that say day and back on my hand. These ladies truly exemplify the highest standard for customer service. My frustration and anger was not toward these two ladies but toward the poor service I received from the people repairing my ring. Now I do not take my ring off. Each ring or necklace I get from Kay’s is not just a piece of jewelry, but it is a story of my life. With these ladies understanding that, they will continue to earn my business from here on out.

When we returned to look at bands, the sales associate proceeded to tell us that it isn't a $1300 worth of rewards, it's 1300 rewards points. She also told us you have to spend an outrageous amount to even redeem any of your "$1300" reward points. That same day I had my ring and band sent off to be resized. The sales lady told me that they would be ready on the twentieth, which was nearly two weeks. I showed up today to pick up my rings, and a very rude pretentious older sales man informed me that neither of my rings were ready to pick up and that I would have to come back another time. I was pretty pissed to say the least. And I am still waiting for a call about picking up my rings. I would not recommend this store at all.

name: Jason
text: The Zales in Foley Alabama has employees that will mislead you. The told my wife a size 7 ring with wrap around stones could be sized to a 5. Then stated it would be a 3 to 4 week wait to get it sized, then recommended another jeweler to size it in 24 hours. We bought the ring ( over $1000) and went to the other jeweler who said there was no way he could sized it and they knew. When we took it back ( 1 hour later) they started acting like they could only refund $200, they did end up refunding the whole amount. This sale was a blatant lie from the beginning.  An attempt to make a sale at all costs and not refund your money. Full of lies.

name: Kathrine Steinbach
text:
I’ve always heard bad things about signet owned jewelry stores and big brand jewelry stores but I never experienced it first hand until I visited this store.

I received a lovely white sapphire ring as a gift which was purchased online. About a month after receiving the ring, it became apparent to me that the main stone was loose (it was not only wiggly and I could feel it, but it was actually rattling audibly). From being loose there was dust/dirt trapped between the stone and the basket of the stone. Keep in mind I had not been wearing it daily so it was surprising it came loose after such a short period of time.

I brought the ring to the foley Zales to have the sterling silver prongs tightened and the basket cleaned. The rep there said since it wasn’t purchased with warranty I had to pay out of pocket for both the cleaning and repair. It would cost $90.00. (Almost as much as the gift itself, but I couldn’t do anything about the fact it hadnt been purchased without a warranty and I wasn’t going to call up the person who gave it to because that would be rude).

When I picked up the ring I was ready to pay for services done, except the moment my hands touched it I knew it was still loose. I showed the representatives behind the counter and they swore up and down to me that it wasn’t loose and it was my imagination. They wiggled it and one even got her pen ink on it trying to “disprove” me.

They said they could send it back free of charge so I said ok. But I got a bad feeling and since it had become a sentimental gift I felt like I no longer trusted that store to handle it since I felt like they were lying to me about it not being loose. I asked them for it back and they said yes but they would have to charge me the $90.00. I didn’t want to have a confrontation with them so I paid and figured maybe I should just get a second opinion because it very well could be my imagination.

She swipes my card and is packing it up and I said “I hear it rattling, tell me you can’t hear that! Call me crazy, It can’t be my imagination!”

She held it up to her ear and to my surprise said “yes! I do hear it rattling. You’re not crazy”.

Im dumbfounded!! Before I paid, she said it wasn’t loose, lied to my face, then the moment I swiped my card, she acknowledged it was loose!!! I am appalled. I’m just going to dispute the transaction with my bank now because there is no way I trust the people working there. And I’m going to advise the person who purchased it for me to do the same. I won’t be making any purchases from jewelry stores like this again. I learned the hard way, at least this time it was only $90 instead of $900

text: The engagement ring that I had now had for five years kept loosing diamonds every couple of months.  I was so frustrated with this happening. Luckily, every time I went into Kay’s to get it sent off I dealt with the same sweet girl, Elizabeth.  Elizabeth was always very understanding and apologetic.  After about the fourth time of loosing a diamond Elizabeth told me she would talk to her manager to see if they could get me a new ring or just pick out a completely different one.  I sent it off that time and believe it or not, four months later a diamond was missing again. I went back up to Kay’s and luckily Elizabeth was there and I didn’t even have to explain to her what happened, she remembered every detail we had talked about.  I ended up picking out a simple solitaire ring. I hated having to change the ring design but luckily because of Elizabeth’s AMAZING customer service and patience the process was a breeze! Every Kay store needs an Elizabeth in their store!

name: Cara Rigby
text:
HORRIBLE MANAGER NAMED MICHELLE!!!

Worst Customer service ive ever experienced anywhere! Went to Kays about a week & a half ago to look and purchase an engagement ring with my fiance. Starting looking at rings in our budget and was only shown 1 ring which I loved (& the girl who showed us the ring got kinda in trouble for showing it to us) until they said they were having a diamond show & started showing me rings from those cases, apparently they only have a diamond show every so often and I was shown about 3 rings or so from those cases & ended up picking one of the 3 after being felt like those were the only ones in our budget and  I was pressured into it. We were able to get the ring sized that day & take it home.

Skip to week or so later, I decided to just browse online at rings that were in our budget & that said available in store at my local store. Came across several beautiful rings that I was NEVER shown to begin with so I decided to call and speak with the manager who helped us & told her about how I had seen a few online that said they were available in store & in our budget, so I go to the store to see them in person to make sure I didn't pick the wrong ring.
Got there & the manager who from the first visit was super helpful and nice, didn't speak to me once when I entered the store. I showed the girl who was helping me a few rings I seen online that said they were in store & the first ring she said " oh we just sold that ring" the 2nd and 3rd ring I showed her she Said " I don't think we have it" & I was like "why would it say it was in store if It wasnt?" She couldn't give me an answer. She did everything in her power to convince me to keep the ring I had but that pissed me off even more so I still ended up returning the ring which I know they aren't happy about, but I wasn't happy with being pretty much only shown options that benefited them. They didn't treat me the same as the first experience & u just don't do your customers that way. Regardless. I will do everything to make sure everyone is aware of how crooked this place is.

Also, after returning the ring (which was leased throigh progressive) we made an account online to see how the process of the refund was going, come to find out our total was double the price we were told it would be in store from the kay employees. The deposit we put down was suppose to be 79 dollars and would also be the amount of our monthy payment & after looking online we discovered they charged us 86 dollars for the deposit & that our payments would be 91.60 WEEKLY! We were told 79 dollars and some change monthly and then it shot up to 91.60 weekly! They never went over the contract or interest rate with us.

After the return I asked the employee if everything on their end was done and all we were waiting on was the leasing company to do their part. Called the leasing company to find out that they were waiting on KAYS to send the invoice over to get the refund process done & taken care of.

Called Kays once again to speak with the unprofessional, rude heifer off a "Manager" to make sure they sent the invoice in and to try to get some answers as to why she never vocally disclosed with us while signing the lease that our total was actually double the price she told us, & she would not answer the question. All she would say was "you made the return, what else do you need, blah blah.." How they can get away with is beyond me, after asking her multiple times times she actually HUNG UP on us. I called bk & another girl asnwer the phone, I continued to try to get answers we as customers deserved & as I was speaking the girl started pressing buttons on the phone & then hung up on me, incredibly immature & unprofessional. I am mind blown at my experience. I made a complaint with corporate, with the better business Bureau and got intouch with the district manager with the help of another kays manager of a different location!
KAYS IS A FREAKING JOKE, THEY LIE & NEVER FULLY DISCLOSE THE FULL TRUTH & PRICE TO THEIR CUSTOMERS IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR SALES & COMMISSION!
